roleset.name: potential belief, expectation, often of something negative

role.descr: attributive: entity arg1 suspects something of

example.name: suspect-v: just transitive
example.text: Mark Shepperd, an analyst at UBS Phillips& Drew in London, said, ``I suspect (the departure) will be fairly irrelevant for the company.
example.arg: (the departure) will be fairly irrelevant for the company.

example.name: suspect-v: passive extraction
example.text: [Those employees]-1 are suspected *trace*-1 of illegally gaining an estimated $376.8 million, the prosecutor was quoted as saying by the Excelsior news service.
example.arg: of illegally gaining an estimated $376.8 million,

example.name: ARG0 and ARG2 and ARG1
example.text: So , it is extremely ridiculous and unscientific to blame and suspect the car and the car manufacturer for such an accident .
example.arg: the car and the car manufacturer

example.name: suspicion-n: args 0 and 1
example.text: his suspicion that the unrecognized inflationary culprit is thebudget surplus
example.arg: that the unrecognized inflationary culprit is thebudget surplus

example.name: suspicious-j: args 1, 2, common in medical
example.text: This is suspicious for a renal cell carcinoma .

roleset.note: SUSPECT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'suspect' based on financial subcorpus; adjectival 'suspicious' based on BOLT-4,5, medi-seedcorpus. Member of VNcls conjecture-29.5-1, consider-29.9-2, suspect-81. (from suspect.01-v)
SUSPICION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on suspect-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls conjecture-29.5-1, consider-29.9-2, suspect-81. (from suspicion.01-n)
SUSPICIOUS-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from suspicious.01-j)
SUSPICIOUS-J NOTES: Should only be used with this sense when discussing a particular suspicion
SUSPECT-J NOTES: Based on medcal notes. Comparison with suspect.01. Framed by Nick and Katie. (from suspect.01-j)

roleset.name: being prone to distrust, paranoia

role.descr: act by which arg0 expresses suspicion, e.g. a glance

example.name: suspicious-j
example.text: It would have to be explained in great predictive detail for me to consider it , and even then I would be highly suspicious .

example.name: suspicious-j
example.text: Many people are suspicious of lobbyists

roleset.note: Split from suspect-01 by Tim on 2016-2-16

roleset.name: questionable; exhibiting shady, sketchy characteristics

role.descr: thing or event acting in ways that evoke suspicion

example.name: suspicious-j
example.text: The security guards look out for any suspicious activity

example.name: suspicious-n arg2 as subject
example.text: I'll be honest, though: overly perfect-looking food is suspicious to me.

example.name: AMR only adverbial functions
example.text: Timmy was suspiciously silent about the missing cookies

roleset.note: Split from suspect-01 by Tim on 2016-2-16
